comments.author: Pmalek
comments.body: Not that we need any additional proof to confirm that 1xBit has a long history of scamming its clients, but your OP doesn't include any important information for the scam accusation to be taken seriously. If you posted something like that about a different site, maybe one with a good track record, no one would believe you and you would be asked to follow the appropriate scam format and/or post proof to support your claims. Anyone who has been on Bitcointalk long enough knows about what this particular gambling provider can do. But they spend plenty of money on advertising, and I believe they are luring in many new players who have no idea what is going to happen to them in the future.

comments.body: I agree with Pmalek, despite 1xbit's bad reputation, providing necessary evidence to support your claim is needed. I am not saying that you are lying but it would make your scam accusation a lot more valid/believable if you can provide evidence.Quote from: Don Pedro Dinero on July 23, 2022, 06:31:08 AMYou registered on the forum on March 15, 2020, 03:49:39 PM and you still didn't know that 1xBit was a scam?Looking at OP's post history it seems like he was not that active in the forum, so I am not surprised if he never knew about the bad reputation of 1xbit.
